reviews.review_msg: One of the worst profsclasses I have taken at SFU. The most confusing person to follow, whether it's lectures or assignment expectations. She got so upset that students kept leaving her AWFUL lectures that she started telling TA's to mark harder & stopped providing lecture notes, which were needed for assignments. Just awful, -310 would recommend

just awful. seriously awful. I would never take a class with her again. Terrible formatting no clarity on assignments whatsoever. I'm still lost on what assignment #2 was about (archive or semiotics). Why is this class even required I didn't learn anything.
Best Prof I've had in university. Informative, passionate lectures. Very demanding with assignment expectations, but I learned so much.
Very kind, and great assignments, however, lectures we slow and her notes were hard to follow. Overall enjoyed the course.

Kirsten is a great prof. I learned alot from her class and ended up enjoying it so much more than I expected. There is ALOT of reading and you need to use them for the assignments. She has wonderful TAs - I'd take a class with her again!

Went back to her themes&just repeated them. some lectures were more of an idea - ie AUTHORITY, and werent explored too well. she used low-brow cliches about people to prove her point. I found her sense of humur annoying; she's friendly tho. TA Ayaka was very helpful tho and our tutrl's stimulating & focused. hwk easy enough and fun, got me excited!

The material makes sense but the approach is to sporadic to follow. The notes are barely comprehensible, and McAllister likes to make up her own vocab, but the course is valuable and the assignments are enjoyable.

Kirsten a warm and very approachable instructor. Her lectures are dull, and her notes are not precise. However, this doesn't impede understanding of the material. Conversely, the assignments are fascinating and really well thought out. As it is a 'research methods' course, you will be stunned by what you learn when you apply the instructed methods.

262 could have been super dull, but it was way more interesting than i expected. She's very approachable for extra help/clarification, and is a good resource if you're interested in doing research down the road. As for hotness - it's a stupid category , but for what it's worth, i think she's one of the best looking folks in the CMNS department.
It is dull material, but Kirsten makes it about at interesting as it can get:)

Terribly boring lecturer. I would never take another class from her. Her assignments left no room for any creative thinking (she's very controlling). She might as well have just written the papers because she was only open to hearing her own opinion. Did not learn anything interesting in her class....Torturous attending her lecutures.

I'm blown away by what an immensely inept lecturer McAllister is. The class is a complete waste of time & money. Yes, she means well but really, she/we should be put out of her teaching misery.  Possibly the most useless instructor I've ever had. Her examples are terrible & she has the intellectual vigour of a housefly. I've learned zilch from her.
If you're actually interested in the field of communications, you'll enjoy the way this course explores many different aspects of research. Ayaka is very helpful.

She explains step by step how to answer questions which felt like high school again. Her lectures are okay, but got a bit dull near the end. I suggest printing out lecture slides and adding notes to them because she explains each of her points. Her mt and assignment 1 was easy, but make sure you have the textbook for assignm  2 and take home final.

I really like her and her lectures. She's actively working in the field she teaches in and uses a lot of examples, discusses race and gender in meaningful ways. Get ready for dudebros in your class to make fun of her accentyou can understand her fine.

Dont have to go lecture, she posts her notes on her website and thats all shes talks about in lecture. (but I recommend to go to the lecture before midterm, she tells How to Write your midterm). Dont have to read textbook either, they are used for assignments. Not a stressing class at all.
Lectures are a bit on the dry side but that's mostly the material, and her teaching methods - however, Ayaka herself as a person seems like a superb, very kind person. Easy course overall.

Easiest course ever. Lectures were a waste of time and insanely boring so I never went, although Ayaka did seem very nice. Grade was based on tutorial participation, mini quiz, two assignments and take home final. TA Matthew was by far the best TA ive ever had! Readings were only needed to complete the assignments/take home final. Recommended!

Not only was the subject matter boring but she was like a robot reading off her notes. She did not like questions or interruptions and her assignments were extremely confusing. I thankfully had the best TA but I wouldn't take another class with her.

Nice lady, but she's just really not a good public speaker. Her lectures put me to sleep, and not just because they were on a Tuesday morning. I ended up skipping almost all of them (except for the quizzes), and it didn't impact my grade at all. Easy course, but super boring.

Scott is a hard marker and takes the content beyond the level of the course. He likes to go on philosophical rants that don't end up proving anything at all. I went to his classes more for entertainment value than to learn. Do not have him as your TA if you are used to good marks.

worst ta ever. if it wasn't for participation marks i wouldn't even attend and i didn't even end up with a good mark. likes to pick on students and probably favours. i get out of tutorial feeling like i wasted an hour sitting there starring into space. he is NOT helpful at all.

scott was the worst ta ive ever had. one snotty guy who is a hard and unfair marker . i dont know how im going to pass the final under the logic behind his marking. i have nothing good to say about him, and am suprised that some people actually rate him well.
Scott is rude, arrogant, and egotistical. He is uninterested in your opinion, although he asks for it in the first place.
Arthur is a really knowledgable and helpful instructor. His input into papers etc is really helpful. He is very understanding in case of emergency.
Just wanted to post something asking who the hell listed Kathi as 'hot'? LOL
She is a funny and nice lady, her lectures are clear. I just love to see her walking in the class with a bottle of diet coke in her hand.

Really great prof. Interesting lectures on an otherwise dead boring topic. Fun to listen to and great ppts. Super nice and understanding if you go see her in her office hours. The major assignments were quite a bit of work, but not an unreasonable amount. I'd definitely take more courses from her in the future. :D
Nice prof who shows care for her students. Attending lectures are optional as recordings and slides are available online. No textbook use as everything is available on WebCT.
She is quite funny and very helpful.

the course itself is still developping so its a bit unorganized. hard to get a good idea of what they wanted in assignments. Shesa good lecturer, i enjoyed listening. But dont go to her with questions. Shes a bit rude in-person. Maybe just not a "people"person. She even emailed us To ask qs to the tas not her. good as long as u dont need help.

While the course material and lectures were clear, the assignments were not. This was apparently a new way of teaching this course and it showed. Two of the assignments required a program that was never taught in classes or tutorials. TA was unhelpful. Assignment guidelines were confusing and unclear of what you would be graded for/on.

The lectures are very important to attend because all of the assignments are tied to the lectures. Professor Reilly is very friendly and always welcome to help with the problems. However,  my TA wasn't very helpful, he would talk most of the time and give confusing examples. Back to prof, explains materials very clearly, caring, and very open.

Professor Reilly is an outstanding lecturer. You will go from taking this class as mandatory credit and to leaving inspired. Go to lecture. Her lessons and teachings are invaluable. However, the quizzes and midterms were positivist beasts: convoluted and ambiguous multiple choice or fill in the blank questions. It won't matter how long you study.

She summarizes the readings for you with her lectures. Her lecture notes are very helpful. She is easy to understand, and clear. Super nice, super fun. She made dry content interesting and not dry. Hands down best prof I've ever had!

I enjoyed this course a lot.  While the material can be a little dry, Prof. Reilly teaches the fundamentals needed in Design and Method in Qualitative Communication Research to success in field research.  With a title like that, I didn't expect this to be a creative writing course.

I have no idea why these previous reviews are the way they are. Cmns 262 was absolutely fine. She's very clear when she lectures and she IS teaching about positivist theory since it is a methods class. If you don't like the material, then don't take the class, it's not her fault. Anyways, she's great, but the mark really depends on your TA.
extremely boring and dry.
She is a nice prof, but seems to expect much from the students,dont take cmns262 with her,super boring materials,I felt like liking a philosophy class in the first half of the course.
This class did not have a good flow to it and the material was incredibly boring. Tutorials were a snoozer.
Very dry content.

She is such an AMAZING prof!  Lectures were a pleasure to attend. She made a difficult and dry course into something that was not only bearable but actually enjoyable! Most assigned readings were always current, relevant, and interesting. I would def take another class from her again!

Very nice, and truly informative during lectures. Many questions brought from the readings will be clearly identified from her lectures. She doesn't go off-topic and is very helpful in clarifying anything.

Fiona is amazing! I took qualitative with her and she is so good at teaching all the techniques and her assignments were fun as well. Take your research courses with Fiona she is so helpful and makes an effort to meet one on one with all her students.
BEST PROF!! YOU ARE LUCKY TO TAKE HIS CLASS!
